body:
Comment 11: 
I'd like to make it easier to set up a Windows machine for building Go binaries.

Right now if I lost my current VM I'd have to figure it all out again.

A while ago bradfitz wrote this a tool (https://code.google.com/p/winstrap/) that gets a
vanilla Windows VM into a somewhat usable state. It would be great to extend that (fork
it?) to also download and install the correct versions of WiX.

If that can be done, I am totally in favour of updating to a newer version of WiX.

I would also like investigate moving makerelease to a separate repository that can be
managed independent to the Go release cycle. That would resolve any issues you have with
the wix scripts coming from one version of Go and makerelease coming from another. I'll
create a separate issue for that.
